page.title: 17Glenisla School Trip. Page 1
page.content: At 9o'clock on Friday 21st June 1985 a bus with children and parents aboard left Glenisla School for the annual school outing. Blair Drummond Safari Park was to be our destination. It was very wet when we left and remained so for the rest of the day! The bus drove round the safari park when we arrived and we saw some lions, tigers, deer and buffaloes. We had to look hard to find them as they were doing the sensible thing and sheltering from the rain. Later we were allowed to wander by ourselves in the enclosed area. We played on the motorbikes and moon buggies, watched films on Cinema 180 and spent our money on ice cream and sweets. We bought presents from the souvenir shop. The astroglide, a giant chute, was closed as it was wet and this was a disappontment.
